Bibliographic metadata.Title: Mineral prospectivity mapping of orogenic gold mineralization in the Malartic-Val-d’Or Transect area, Metal Earth project, Canada
Bibliographic metadata.Author: Ahmad Reza Mokhtari, Pouran Behnia, Bruno Lafrance, Mostafa Naghizadeh, Jack M. Simmons, Jeff R. Harris

Abstract: Mineral Prospectivity Mapping has been applied to define exploration targets for orogenic gold mineralization in the Malartic-Val-d’Or area of the Abitibi greenstone belt. This research utilizes lithological, geophysical, and structural data to investigate factors controlling gold distribution. Stepwise logistic regression and random forest algorithms were employed to map mineral prospectivity for gold potential. The random forest method outperformed logistic regression, indicating strong predictors for distinguishing mineralized and non-mineralized locations.
Methodology: supervised > tree-based > random forest; supervised > generalized linear models > logistic regression

types: Shear zone with multi-ring buffer; Unknown

Key points: Application of machine learning techniques for mineral prospectivity mapping.
Random forest method demonstrated superior performance compared to logistic regression.
Identification of critical factors influencing gold exploration.
Integration of predictive models with geophysical data enhances understanding of gold deposit formation.
